website_summaries.verdict: Step right up to the Canon ImageClass MF3110 for swift laser prints and scans but don't expect it to run your office.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Use With Windows 7 (64bit)
customer_reviews.text: I have used the MF3110 for several years and have enjoyed the laser printing qualities. However, I just bought a new computer with Win 7 (64 bit) and per conversation Canon this printer will not run with this OS, nor do they plan to update the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: paula7890

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I like Canon printers. This one in particular was a good price, works well, and I'm still on the "starter" ink cartridge hundreds of pages later. The scan function works better than I imagined. The one page feed is easy to use. I am now using this as my main printer, with our more expensive Canon delegated to my husband's use.
customer_reviews.author: Cincinnati mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still working fine after several years - a workhorse of a printer/scanner
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laser copier for a small office
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, Canon discomntinued this model. You will have a devil of a time finding one used in good shape, much less, new.
customer_reviews.author: R. GANGER

customer_reviews.title: the printer part works great
customer_reviews.text: and the scan quality is wonderful. However, the scanning software's functionality is limited. Scanning functions are not too intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Think Adopt First

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for VALUE
customer_reviews.text: a 5 star rating is admittedly very high, but this multifunction machine merits them all on the basis of value. I am truly dumbfounded by the quality and features you get for such a low price. There is no catch, it is the real deal. Speedy, high quality black and white laser prints and a very capable scanner. Just what is needed for the SOHO environment. It replced my old NEC 870 printer which was a workhorse for 7.5 years before dying. I am so impressed by it that I am recommending it to all my friends. I do way too much research before I buy a product like this and it has surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Terrific printer - but not with a 64-bit system
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer/copier/scanner, for all the reasons others give here. Easy to operate, performs flawlessly and at a decent speed, scans easily without any fuss, and isn't a toner hog. The only problem with it is that it does not work with the 64-bit version of Windows 7. I just bought a new desktop and found to my dismay that I could not a driver for the MF3110 because of this issue. So buy it if you can find one - but check first to make sure your system is 32 bit.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Clapham

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this multifunction Canon for a year now, and it's worth every penny (not that it cost much). I use it for light home office duties. Not only was the setup easy (essentially plug and play with USB), but it prints crisply and quickly. No jams yet, and I'm still on the toner cartridge that came with the printer. The copy function works quite well. I have not had occasion to use the scanner function much. The one downside is that the unit is rather large and heavy, but on the whole it is par for the course for this kind of multifunction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to let anyone know my experience. I have had this product since 2005. It has never failed me. I use it at home with my husband's small handyman business. We print invoices and letters. I print everything for the children. I scan and copy. I love this product and for the money, I am very pleased. I would most definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon B

customer_reviews.title: Caution - Canon stopped supporting this printer
customer_reviews.text: Was (formerly) an OK printer in my opinion. Only big complaint is that when I purchased a new laptop with win 7 x64, discovered that Cannon did not create drivers for this printer. MF5700 is supposed to be a hack substitute, but I couldn't get it working, perhaps since Cannon recently updated. So if you are sure you will use old windows, and not upgrade to their latest poor product offering, then this printer is not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pallaver

customer_reviews.title: We're happy with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I would say it jams only a little more frequently than I'd expect, which is mildly annoying, but overall this is a great printer for the price, especially with the ability to create pdf documents included. The image/print quality is good. We use this as our main office printer and scanner and probably print 50-100 sheets a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Longacre

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable performance but durability lacking
customer_reviews.text: The performance of the MF3110 is okay (especially for the price) but I found that the durability was lacking--my died after 5 months and it would cost more to ship it and get it fixed than to buy a completely new one. Also, the output is not the sharpest compared to other b/w lasers.
customer_reviews.author: techguy

customer_reviews.title: Very Good so far
customer_reviews.text: This printer has all the functions I was looking for. I did have to call support to customize the paper due to the fact that I need to print a special size that is not configured in to the printer and they were very helpful and resolved the problem quickly. I am dissappointed a little with the scanning properties. It is very slow and there seems to be a lot of steps to save files. Overall, a great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boughan

customer_reviews.title: it is very bad
customer_reviews.text: I had this machine for two years. The first year was great. Now, it gave me all kind of the troubles. The worst one is the paper jam. it will jam even you only put one page in the paper tray.It also has problems with paper setting. It will give you error messages even when you have the correct setting.Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Li Xu

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: This set up quickly and it prints just fine for regular size paper. It does well scanning also. It prints pretty quickly. The toner does seem to last. However, beyond these points don't expect anything else. Labels shift. Envelopes are impossible to print. I have used this printer/copier/scanner since Jan 05. If you are looking for a basic printer copier. This works.
customer_reviews.author: Busy PT

customer_reviews.title: Hard worker - no problems
customer_reviews.text: I own this printer for about 8 months and I am realy happy with it. Printer settings could be more easy or the LCD monitor could be larger but you get used with it. I print hundreds of A4 everyday and paper jams happend only 2-3 times. This is a very good score! I do not use it as a scanner very often but scannings look great too. Fully recommended for home and office use.
customer_reviews.author: Paliokas

customer_reviews.title: JUNK-IN-A-BOX
customer_reviews.text: The one star is for the pretty box. The new machine inside was dead-on-arrival. Called Canon for help. They spent twenty minutes trying to help and gave up. Invited me to accept a refurbished model in exchange. So much for public relations. Returned unit to store for full refund. Will not deal with Canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Waber

product_meta.title: Canon ImageCLASS MF3110 Laser Multifunction
product_meta.description:
At home or at a small office, space is often a premium. Instead of getting a computer printer, a scanner, and a copier as three separate units, it might be wiser and more affordable to put all those functions together in one unit. That's the concept of a multifunction device. The Canon ImageClass MF3110 does all that and does it extremely well. With all the features you need for copying, printing and scanning, the imageCLASS MF3110 has the functions you need to keep pace in any busy office. Copy letter-size documents at a speed of 21 copies-per-minute and enjoy the same speed for your laser printing. Print resolutions run at 1200 x 600 dpi and copy resolutions runs at 600 x 600 dpi for sharp production. A color scanner with CCD technology ensures that scanned images are more true to the original using up to 1200 x 2400 dpi optical to 9600 x 9600 dpi interpolated resolutions at up to 48-bit color depth. Scanned documents can input directly to your computer (scan editing software is included). 

 The printer itself is monochrome - printing grayshades. It uses a fast reliable laser print mechanism that's quiet and sharp. The included X25 cartridge has an up to 2500 page printing capacity, far greater than most ink cartridges. That means more prints at a lower cost. So for home biz or small biz, the Canon MF3110 is a high value product that you'll love to own and use. When space and productivity are significant issues, the MF3110 is truly a best buy in this class. Included software on CD - Canon driver for Windows, ScanSoft OmniPage SE (OCR), NewSoft Presto! Page Manager Large capacity up to 250 sheet front-load paper cassette tray Works with Windows 98/Me/2000/XP Has USB and Parallel port connectivity Multifunction LCD screen Individual unit dimensions 17.7(W) x 18.2(D) x 14.5(H) / Weighs about 25 pounds Canon USA 1-Year Limited Warranty
feature_bullets: Prints, copies, and scans in one convenient unit
Up to 21 ppm print speed, up to 1,200 x 600 dpi resolution
Reduces and enlarges copies from 50 to 200% in 1% increments
USB 2.0 interface, optional external print server; PC compatible

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars28 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
